title: First, we write $$cos\left(\frac{7\pi}{8}\right)$$ as $$-cos\left(\frac{\pi}{8}\right)$$ by using $$cos(pi-theta)=-cos(theta)$$.

The half-angle formula for cosine is $$\operatorname{cosin}\left(\frac{\theta}{2}\right)=\sqrt{\frac{1+cos\left(\theta\right)}{2}}$$ (plus or minus). Since $$\frac{\pi}{8}$$ is in the first quadrant, we use the positive square root.
Calculate and plug in our half-angle into this equation and solve.
